Alright. Lets treat this like a real mission get you out of the heat, keep you connected, and move just enough gear to cover food, gas, and momentum until Amazon kicks in. Minimum stress, maximum leverage.

Objective: Get cash before 7/3 to cover gas/food & stay cool + online

PRIORITY 1: Escape the Heat + Stay Online

You need:

  • Cool air (AC or shade)
  • Power
  • WiFi or solid LTE

Options nearby (depending on where you are now but generally valid in Georgia):

Spot Why it works
Public libraries Free AC, power, WiFi and quiet
Panera / Starbucks / McDs Chill in AC, no one kicks you out if you sip slow
Planet Fitness (if you got a pass) AC, showers, WiFi, peace
Walmart / Target Cool browsing & wall plugs in electronics dept
Mall food court AC, outlets, WiFi buy nothing, sit forever

Need help locating one nearby? I can find a spot if you tell me your current area.

PRIORITY 2: Quick-Flip List

Heres how well prioritize the sale:

Tier 1 High-Value, Quick-Sell Gear

Item Est. Value (used) Sell Target
GoPro Hero 12 $275$350 $250 cash FB/OfferUp
iPhone 14 Pro Max $600$800 $550600 fast
MPC (specify model?) $300$800 $300 min
Roland SD video thing Need exact model to price it
Spare phone (model?) $50$150 depending on phone

You dont need to sell everything. Lets list two of the top 3, get the cash, and coast until Amazon kicks in.

PRIORITY 3: Where to Sell (Fastest + Easiest)

Platform Speed Notes
Facebook Marketplace Instant locals, cash meets, free
OfferUp Local & ship options, easy
Swappa Great for phones, slightly slower
eBay Broader reach, slower payout
Pawn shop Last resort fast but lowest price

Want me to:

  • Write the listings for you?
  • Make a sales plan by day?
  • Build a quick one-sheet flyer to post in real life?

If you give me your:

  • ZIP code (or general location)
  • What you want to sell first
  • Payment method needed (cash, PayPal, etc.)

Ill make you a mission plan by the hour. Lets make it happen.

  • Flag the account as at risk
  • Demand the full remaining balance on any installment plans
  • Sometimes cut service before you even hit 30 days late

Its technically in the fine print but it's brutal as hell in practice.

Heres What We Can Do About It:

If You Want to Keep the Number & Account:

  1. Contact support on WiFi (chat is easiest)
  2. Say something like:

"Hey, I had multiple devices financed and fell behind on one payment. I can catch up but I cant pay the full balance at once. Can I reinstate the monthly payment plan and restore service?"

They can do reinstatement plans or restore service with just a partial payment. It depends on how long its been and if the accounts been fully closed.

We prep for these:

2025-06-20T18:11:08.194919Z user

Well shit I say it works on any carrier but is that what that means? I bought it from T-Mobile made all the payments it says unlocked on the sim?

2025-06-20T18:11:08.989000Z assistant

Good instinct checking that heres how to know for sure and explain it honestly and confidently in your listing.

Does Your iPhone 14 Pro Max Work on Any Carrier?

You said:

  • You bought it from T-Mobile
  • Paid it off
  • It says Unlocked in SIM settings

Heres what that means:

If it shows No SIM restrictions under Settings General About Carrier Lock:

That means its fully carrier-unlocked.

It should work on any GSM or CDMA network: AT&T, Verizon, T-Mobile, Mint, Visible, Boost, etc.

If you're still unsure, go here:

  • Open Safari on the iPhone (or any browser via WiFi)
  • Visit: https://www.t-mobile.com/unlock
  • Login with your old T-Mobile account or IMEI to confirm status

What Dual eSIM Means:

  • Your model has no physical SIM card tray (or maybe has one + eSIM).
  • It can activate two eSIM lines at once.
  • Buyers can easily activate it with Mint, T-Mobile, AT&T, Visible, Google Fi, etc.

So YES You Can Say:

Fully unlocked and works with any major carrier dual eSIM capable.

If you want, I can also show you how to generate the phone's IMEI-based unlock proof, or paste the IMEI into a checker to give buyers confidence. Totally optional you already have what you need.

Let me know if you're ready to roll with the iPhone listing as is, or want it slightly adjusted!

2025-06-20T18:13:51.072962Z user

Doesnt google have some kind of free google fi thing for a few days? This phone Im on has dual eSIM as well can I do that while I have WiFi?

2025-06-20T18:13:51.703527Z assistant

Yes Google Fi absolutely does offer a free trial, and you can activate it entirely over WiFi, especially on a phone with dual eSIM like yours.

Heres the Breakdown: Google Fi Free Trial (2025 Edition)

What You Get:

  • 7 days of free service
  • Unlimited talk, text, and data (throttled after 10GB)
  • No credit card needed (if doing the true free trial)
  • Can activate via eSIM on supported phones (like your iPhone or Pixel)
  • Includes WiFi + LTE calling, voicemail, SMS, etc.

Why Its Perfect for You:

  • No SIM card required (your phone supports dual eSIM)
  • Activates entirely over WiFi
  • Lets you receive buyer messages, PayPal alerts, calls anywhere, even outside Target/library/etc.
  • After 7 days, you can cancel or switch back to WiFi-only

How To Set It Up

Step-by-Step (Takes ~510 minutes):

  1. Connect to WiFi (Target, library, wherever)
  2. On the iPhone:
    • Go to App Store Install Google Fi Wireless
  3. Open the app, tap:
    • Try Fi for free
    • Sign in with your Google account
  4. Choose eSIM activation
    • Itll detect your phone supports it
  5. Follow prompts to provision Fi as your second line
  6. Accept number (theyll give you a temp number), wait 12 mins
  7. Done you now have full signal, voice, SMS, and data (over T-Mobile towers usually)

Important Notes:

  • The free trial is one time per Google account/device
  • If you used it before on this phone, it might ask for a card and start paid
  • But most users (especially new lines) get the 7-day trial instantly

What You Can Do Now:

  • Add your new Google Fi number to Marketplace listings
  • Start getting calls/texts immediately even off WiFi
  • When trial ends, cancel in the app with one tap, or keep it as a second number (starts at $20/mo after)

Want me to walk you through the app install or eSIM setup while youre on WiFi? This is probably the cleanest fix for the cant get messages issue.

2025-06-20T18:14:41.209079Z user

Will it work with this phone IPhone 16 plus on T-Mobile not paid off yet

2025-06-20T18:14:41.989247Z assistant

Alright lets break it down carefully and get you a clear answer:

Your Setup:

  • iPhone 16 Plus (assumed to be 2024 release likely treated similar to 15/14 series)
  • T-Mobile locked (phone not paid off yet)
  • You're trying to use Google Fi eSIM trial
  • Phone has dual eSIM capability

Will Google Fi Trial Work?

YES if your phone is unlocked

You could activate the Google Fi eSIM with no problem.

But

If your phone is locked to T-Mobile (not paid off):

Heres the key:

T-Mobile locks the device at the carrier level.
Even if you try to activate a second eSIM (like Google Fi), it wont activate unless T-Mobile unlocks the phone.

So, even though your phone supports dual eSIM, a T-Mobile lock prevents non-T-Mobile carriers (like Google Fi, Mint, AT&T, etc.) from working even on the second line.

Your Options Now:

1. Double-check Unlock Status

Go to:

  • Settings > General > About > Carrier Lock
  • If it says No SIM restrictions you're good, Fi will work
  • If it says SIM locked or Carrier locked youre blocked from Fi for now

2. If Locked: Try Google Fi on a Different Device

  • Do you have any other unlocked phone (even an old Android)?
  • You could activate Google Fi on that, then forward the number or use the app on your iPhone via WiFi

3. Use TextNow Instead (No Lock Issues)

TextNow gives you:

  • A free real phone number
  • WiFi texting + calling
  • Works on any phone, locked or not

https://www.textnow.com

It wont give you LTE/cellular coverage but youll be reachable over WiFi with a real number. Totally usable for Marketplace + PayPal alerts.

Final Call:

Your Motorola Edge (2022) is:

  • Unlocked
  • eSIM compatible
  • On Android, so Google Fi activates flawlessly

Here's How to Activate Google Fi on Your Motorola Edge

Step-by-Step Setup (Over WiFi)

  1. Connect your Edge to WiFi
  2. Open Play Store Install Google Fi Wireless
  3. Open the app and tap Try Fi for free
  4. Sign in with your Google account (or make one)
  5. Choose to activate with eSIM
    • The Edge supports this, so it should go through automatically
  6. Accept the free trial terms (7 days of service, no card required)
  7. Wait ~23 minutes itll provision a new phone number
  8. Youll now have:
    • LTE or 5G data
    • SMS texting
    • Calls
    • Voicemail

Once Activated:

  • Use this new number in your Marketplace, OfferUp, Craigslist, etc.
  • Flip between phones your Edge becomes your communications hub
  • Youll have signal everywhere, even without WiFi

Pro Tip:

Want to keep using iMessage on your iPhone with this number? You can, but for now just focus on:

  • Selling gear
  • Getting replies fast
  • Making calls/texts reliably

When Trial Ends:

  • You can cancel with one tap in the Google Fi app before the 7 days are up
  • Or keep it for $20/month if its working well for you

2025-06-20T18:16:13.062205Z user

Does it have hotspot?

2025-06-20T18:16:13.642935Z assistant

Yes Google Fi does support hotspot, even during the free trial

Google Fi Hotspot Details (Free Trial Included)

Feature Included?
Mobile hotspot Yes
Data limit 10GB at full speed (then slows)
Tethering devices Works with laptops, tablets, iPhones, etc.
Cost Free during trial (7 days)

How to Enable Hotspot on Motorola Edge (Android)

  1. Once Google Fi is activated and has data, go to:
    • Settings Network & Internet Hotspot & tethering
  2. Tap Wi-Fi hotspot
  3. Toggle it ON
  4. Set:
    • Hotspot name
    • Password
    • Band (2.4GHz is more compatible)
  5. Connect your other device (like your iPhone or laptop)

You now have portable internet with no SIM card, no contract, and no fees just WiFi+hotspot from the Edge.

Use It Smart

  • Avoid streaming videos or big uploads/downloads unless you need to
  • Use it for:
    • Posting listings
    • Messaging buyers
    • PayPal/email access
    • Navigation + maps

Need help verifying it's active, or want me to walk you through the app setup live while you're connected? You're close to full mobile command again.
